! Wher e does water come from?
Water is essen tial for life. About 70% of earth's surface is covered with water. 
Mos t of our body weigh t is due to water. Aqua tic life would not have been 
possible without water. Plan ts need water to grow. Water help s our body to 
digest food, transport the nutrien ts and excrete wastes as urine and sweat We 
may fall ill due to short age of water in our body . This condition of water 
short age in our body is called dehydration.
Only about 2.59% of the water on the earth is fit for drinking. The rest 
is salty water which can not be used for drinking.You  Know Must (Knowledge )Water for LivingUnit–V : Our Environment
14
Environmental Studies-4 106

Sources of W ater
No living being can survive without water. We get water from man y sour ces, some 
of sour ces are given belo w–
1. Rain– Rain is the main sour ce of water. It is the purest form of water. 
However, it gets pollut ed due to pollut ants presen t in the air. When rain falls, 
water gets collect ed in the water bodies like sewers, lakes, ponds and oceans. 
It also seep s through the soil and accumula tes under ground as groundw ater.
2. Rivers– Water is presen t in frozen form in glacier s high up in the moun tains. 
Rivers origina te when the ice in glacier s melts due to sun's heat. Mos t of the 
rivers flow into the seas or oceans. 
Ganga originates from Gangotri and Yamuna originates from 
Yamunotri  glacier.You  Know Must (Knowledge )
3. Ponds and Lakes– Rain water also collects into ponds and lake. A pond is a 
small body of water surrounded by land. A lake is a larger body of water than 
a pond. Water in lakes and ponds contains several impurities and germs. So, it 
is not safe for drinking. However, it is used for man y other purposes. Even 
animals drink it and wade through it during summer s to stay coof.
4. Oceans and Seas–  A sea is a very large water body while an ocean is larger 
than a sea. About 97 percent of the total water on earth is presen t in seas and 
oceans. But, this water can not be used for drinking because it is very salty .
Underground W ater
The rainwate r that seeps down into the soil and is stored there is called 
under ground water. The under ground water comes up to the surface at man y 
places as natural springs. Oasis in deserts are formed by under ground water.
For human use the under ground water is drawn out with the help of wells, tube 
wells and hand pump s etc.
Earth is c alled the 'Blu e Planet' .You  Know Must (Knowledge )
Environmental Studies-4107

Water Conservation
Careful use of water is called water conser vation. The increase in popula tion has 
led to scarcity of water. So, it is import ant to conser ve water. Dams, reser voirs and 
canals are built to conser ve water.
In order to conser ve water, it is import ant to use water carefully and avoid its 
wastage. Some of the ways in which we can conser ve water are–
! Taps should be turned off after usag e.
! All leaking pipes and taps should be mended. 
! A mug and water should be used for brushing teeth instead of running tap.
! The leftover water in bottles should be emp tied in potted plan ts.
! Mug and buck et should be used for cleaning car, instead of a hose pipe.
! We should bathe with a buck et and mug instead of a shower.
! Gardener s should use water cans to water the plan ts.
! Rain water should be collect ed in tanks and used for cleaning and gardening 
purposes.
ŸDehydration – short age of water in the body .
ŸPollut ants  – harm ful substances.
ŸAccumula tes – Collects.
Ÿ Wade   – play in water.
Wrap-  U p Wrap-  U pKey Poin ts of the Chap terKey termsKey termsKey terms

Ÿ Rain is the main sour ce of water on earth.
ŸWater is precious. It should be handled carefully.

Let’sKNOW Let’sKNOWStarterWaste ManagementUnit–V : Our Environment
15
Garbag e is any material that is of no use for us and can be thrown away as 
waste. It could be in solid or liquid form. Ther e are man y different kinds of 
wastes that are produced and thrown away every day e.g. plastic cans, 
poly thene bags, vegetable peels, old shoes, old medicines, torn clothes, dry 
leaves etc.
If all these wastes are thrown around in the surroundings, it will create a foul 
smell. It will also attract flies, mosquit oes and other insects which cause 
diseases such as diarrhoea, typhoid, dysentery, malaria, plague etc.
We need to manag e our waste properly other wise we would have garbag e 
lying here and there.! Wha t are the childr en doing in the above pictur es?
! Wha t is the difference between the two pictur es?
! Can you define garbag e?
Environmental Studies-4 112

Ther e are mainly two kinds of wastes–
 (i) Biodegr adable and  (ii) Non-biodegr adableKinds of W astes
Ways of Disposal of W aste
The main ways of disposal of waste are–
1. Burning of garbage– We mostly pile the 
garbag e and burn it. In cities, solid wastes 
(especially medic al waste) are burn t in big 
furnaces called inciner ators. This method is 
called inciner ation. It does not allow insects 
and germs to breed. If also does not create 
any foul smell. However, it causes air 
pollution due to release of toxins and smok e into the air.
2. Open dumping–  In this method, the waste is 
taken to places far away from the city and thrown 
into the open to allow it to decompose with the 
action of air, water and sunligh t. This method is 
harm ful because the dumping area becomes a 
breeding ground for insects and germs. In such 
surroundings, diseases spread very fast.Biodegradable Wastes
1. They decompose or decay easily .
2. They become a part of the soil.
3. Example of such wastes are– 
waste food, paper, vegetable 
peels, dry leaves, animal excreta 
etc.1. They do not decompose easily .
2. They do not become a part of the 
soil.
3. Example of such wastes are– 
plastics, glass, metals, poly thene 
bags etc.Non- biodegradable Wastes
It is very import ant to separ ate different types of wastes at home before the 
garbag e collect or comes to collect the garbag e.
Environmental Studies-4113

Waste Management
Disposing waste is a big problem in mos t cities and towns nowadays because there 
is not enough space for making dumping grounds, land fills or compos t pits etc. 
Ther efore, it is import ant to find a better solution to manag e our waste.
If we beha ve responsibly , waste produced by us can be reduced. The best way to 
manag e waste is to follow the 4 R's concep t– 
The 4 R's stand for – Refuse, Reduce, Reuse and Recycle.
1. Refuse– Refuse simply means to say 'No'. Try to refuse one time use products 
like disposable cups, plates, bottles, straws and other things. Instead, find 
reusable alterna tives.
 Refusing one time use products help s in reducing a lot of waste.
2. Reduce–  We should reduce the amoun t of garbag e we produce. Some ways 
to reduce wastes are—
! Avoid buying things with lots of pack aging materials.
! Avoid buying throw away products like plastic cups, glasses and tins. 
Use washable cups and plastics 3. Land filling–  In this method, big and deep pits 
called land fills are dug outside cities and the 
waste picked up by municipality trucks is 
dumped into these land fills. When these pits 
are filled, they are covered with soil. This 
method is a better way of disposing solid wasted 
as—
! The waste decomposes in the landfills and becomes a part of the soil.
! It does not provide any breeding ground for insects and germs.
! It does not create any foul smell.
4. Compos ting–  In villag es, mos t of the waste produced is biodegr adable. To 
dispose this, people mak e deep pits in the 
ground. The garbage (biodegradable) is 
dumped into these pits and they are covered 
with soil. After some time, this waste turns into 
manure. Farmers use this manure in their 
fields. This method of waste disposal is known 
as compos ting. It is a very good method of 
waste disposal.
Environmental Studies-4 114

! Buy things only if needed.
3. Reuse– Reuse means to use things again rather than throwing them. It can be 
done in man y ways–
! Reuse plastic or glass bottles, jars and container s after they are emp ty.
! Reuse gift wrapping paper to wrap another gift.
! Use old clothes for dusting and cleaning.
! Use old paper s, cartons, pencil shavings and such other wastes to 
create beautiful art and craft material.
! Dona te old story-book s and text-book s to a library.
! Dona te your clothes which are not in use for you now.
4. Recycle– Recycling is the process of converting used items into raw materials 
and making new products again.
! Paper is recycled to mak e new paper .
! Soft drink cans are crushed and melt ed to mak e new cans.
! Broken glass pieces are recycled to mak e new glass container s and jars. 
! Metals can be recycled again and again.
Benefits of R ecycling
! It reduces waste sent to landfills.
! It prevents pollution.
! It conser ves natural resour ces.
! It creates jobs, producing economic bene fits.
By following the 4R's concep t of waste manag emen t, we can save a lot of mone y, 
natural resour ces and our environmen t.
! Dispose off – To get rid of some thing that is of no more use for us.
! Garbag e dump – A place wher e waste is emp tied. 
! Inciner ator – A big container , closed on all sides for burning waste at 
high temper ature.
! Compos t – Decayed matter which is good for soil.Key termsKey termsKey terms
Environmental Studies-4115

       (a) Dry leaves and paper are non-biodegr adable wastes.

  wastes.
 (c) Burning of garbag e causes pollution.
 (d) Reuse means to buy things only if needed.
 (e) Envelopes and gift paper s can be reused.Wrap-  U p Wrap-  U pKey Poin ts of the Chap ter
Ÿ Due to human activities, a lot of waste is produced everyday in houses, 
factories, offices etc.
Ÿ Flies, mosquit oes and other insects breed in dirty surroundings and spread 
diseases like malaria, choler a, plague etc.
Ÿ Waste is of two types – Biodegr adable and non-biodegr adable.
Ÿ Four main ways of the waste disposal are – burning , open dumping , land 
filling and compos ting .
Ÿ The best way to manag e waste is to follow the golden rule of four R's.
Ÿ The four R's stand for Refuse, Reduce, Reuse and Recycle.
TIME TO ANSWER
